comments: A Lamé sequence of higher order.a(n) = number of compositions of n in which each part is >= 7. - _Milan Janjic_, Jun 28 2010a(n+7) equals the number of n-length binary words such that 0 appears only in a run which length is a multiple of 7. - _Milan Janjic_, Feb 17 2015
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000

formula: G.f.: (x-1)/(x-1+x^7). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 04 2008For positive integers n and k such that k <= n <= 7*k, and 6 divides n-k, define c(n,k) = binomial(k,(n-k)/6), and c(n,k) = 0, otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n+7) = sum(c(n,k), k=1..n). - _Milan Janjic_, Dec 09 2011
